Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Izhar (יִצְהָר) descendant of Kohath (קֳהָת) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► opponent of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) ancestor of Korahite (קָרְחִי) clan
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= person in whom one has put one's trust; ◄ because of difficult circumstances; ► in order to find protection or safety
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
literally: to be found (in a place); hence: = state in which humans or objects are located in a certain place

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= process by which objects take on different characteristics

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
literally: heart; hence: = the location right in the middle of something else, such as the sea, the heavens, or a tree
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea
= process by which liquids form small bubbles, ◄ due to agitation or fermentation
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

= state in which a substance increases in volume, which manifests itself in an increasing height|= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= a flowing body of water, but here referring to a specific river or rivers
= a relatively large quantity of liquid flowing with strength
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which people, objects and places have undergone the rituals that are required to make them fit to be in the presence of God or to be used in his service
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which a condition that has been in place for a considerable amount of time is about to come to an end
= process by which a relatively hard object becomes softer

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

Node.gloss: (God as a) stronghold|(God as a) refuge
Node.definition: = a reference to God characterizing him as someone who provides security
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

Node.gloss: to cut in pieces|to break|to snap
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans damage an object by breaking it into separate parts
= a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp iron (בַּרְזֶל) head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer

= two or four wheeled carriage or cart, used for travel or the transport of loads; pulled by draft animals, such as oxen (שֹׁור) donkeys (חֲמֹור) or horses (סוּס)|= a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans acknowledge the elevated status of deities and give expression to that

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= action by which humans acknowledge the elevated status of deities and give expression to that

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

Node.gloss: (God as a) stronghold|(God as a) refuge
Node.definition: = a reference to God characterizing him as someone who provides security
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
